content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` that performs the specified cleaning on column names. Here's how you could implement it:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the string
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, r"\s|-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

This function takes a string `col` representing a column name, and it returns the cleaned version of the column name. The cleaning process involves lowercasing the string, stripping any leading or trailing whitespace, and replacing spaces and hyphens with underscores.

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```

This will output "my_column" after applying the cleaning steps to "My Column".
